justification: It notes Team B’s appetite for ceiling and rookies, but ignores B’s comfort buying low on injured stars (making them less eager to swap Josh Martin). It misreads Team A’s preferences: A is injury-averse yet targets a Questionable RB and doesn’t gain a possession WR. The “consistency + friendly schedule” claim is thin (only Torres has friendly playoffs; Martin is mixed). Trade is feasible but lopsided and poorly justified.
